title: Midnight Chase
gameText: Play this card on any Agent to immediately skip one combat round for that Agent. The Agent takes no damage that round and may not deal any damage either.
dialogue: "Well, whatever it is you do believe, Scully…when you walk into that room nothing sacred will hold." - Mulder

title: Identity Intrusion
gameText: Play this card to gain control of an Agent during a single Combat round (your choice).
dialogue:
Scully: "What does that mean?"
Mulder: "It means... It means whatever you want it to mean. Good night."

title: Hostages
gameText: Play after an Adversary card has been successfully played on a Site. Discard a card from your hand to add X [CP] to your pool. X = Half the cost of the Adversary played (rounded down).
dialogue: "I just want to say that I believe you." - Kimberley

title: Field Treatment
gameText: Play on any Agent in the Field to immediately heal 2 points of damage after an LRC round.
dialogue: "This is Albert Hosteen. He's been translating your files." - Scully

title: FBI Crossroads
gameText: Play this card during an LRC round on a combatant you control with an LRC skill. That combatant and one other combatant's HEALTH by two during the Combat.
dialogue:
Scully: "Damn it, Skinner!
Mulder: "Drop your weapon!"
Skinner: "Back off!"

title: FBI Raid
gameText: Play this card during a combat on a Team of Agents to reduce damage from an Adversary's LRC by two points. The team still deals damage during that LRC round.
dialogue: Scully: "Mulder! The landlady's body! We found her in the bathroom!"

title: Emergency Evacuation
gameText: Play this card at the end of any Combat round to allow up to two Agents in that Team to leave the Combat if their HEALTH was not reduced to zero yet. Both Agents may still contribute their skills to other skill checks and be moved to the Hospital this turn.
dialogue: "I want an apology for the truth." - Mulder

title: Hidden Twin-Barrell
gameText: Play this card on any combatant to increase or decrease that Combatant's LRC by two points during that round.
dialogue: "It's open. Can I help you?" - Geraldine

title: Agent Medical Escort
gameText: One Agent (your choice) may immediately "escort" another Agent in the same Team if forced to go to the Hospital (only if chosen Agent is not required to go to the Hospital too). The escorted Agent may remove three additional points of damage while being accompanied during the next healing phase.
dialogue: "I just wanted to make sure you got where you were going safely." - Scully

title: Battle Expertise
gameText: Target Agent or Adversary gains an extra LRC/CRC bonus skill equal to the number of Combat cards in your Discard pile.
dialogue: "He's got a gun" - Mulder

title: B.A.T.F. Reinforcements
gameText: Play this card on target Team during a Combat to get an extra combatant in that Team with following skills: LRC: 3, CRC: 2, HEALTH: 5. Discard this card after the Combat phase had ended.
dialogue:
Mulder: "Is there contact with the temple?"
Agent: "If you call that contact."

title: Adversary's Rebirth
gameText: Play this card on an Evolutionary Adversary immediately after the Combat has ended, when that Adversary played is sent to the Discard Pile. You can start another Combat with the same Adversary for half cost (rounded up) against the same Team of Agents.
dialogue: Scully: "Mulder, I don't know what you're getting at here. Regeneration of an entire body?. I don't know why I'm standing here listening to this."

title: Renewed Threat
gameText: Play this card at the end of a Combat round on any Adversary card you control to return that Adversary card back to your hand only if the Adversary has not been defeated yet at the end of that round. You can play the Adversary card again (usual rules and cost).
dialogue: Mulder: "If Modell makes it through surgery, I want to be the first person that he talks to."

title: Opening Fire
gameText: Play on any combatant during one LRC round. That combatant will deal damage to their opponents first. If the HEALTH value of any opponent reaches zero after applying modifiers or healing cards, that combatant is sent to the Hospital and cannot deal any damage back that round.
dialogue: Mulder: "You murdered my father, you killed Scully's sister, and if Scully dies, I will kill you."

title: Quick Strike
gameText: Play on any combatant during one CRC round. That combatant will deal damage to their opponents first. If the HEALTH value of any opponent reaches zero after applying modifiers or healing cards, that combatant is sent to the Hospital and cannot deal any damage back that round.
dialogue: "Don't telegraph that left, Dre. Stevie Wonder would see that one coming. You're fighting the FBI now, Dre. Fight smart. Go!" - Skinner's coach

title: Masked Identity
gameText: Play this card any time during a Combat on any Adversary. If the Adversary's HEALTH was not reduced to zero yet, you may allow that Adversary to end Combat and return the card to your hand, but you cannot play the Adversary again this turn.
dialogue: "I like to say whoever God didn't get around to creating in his own image, it's our job to recreate in ours." - Doctor Kaplan

title: FBI and SWAT Strike
gameText: Play this card on any Agent during the LRC round to add 2 points to that Agent's LRC skill. Additionally, if there is a CRC round, you can reduce the damage from any source by 2 points.
dialogue: "Federal agent, I'm armed! Exit the vehicle, now!" - Mulder

title: Suicide Run
gameText: Play this card on any Team of Agents at the end of any Combat round. If the Adversary you control is still alive, then You can discard that card to send to the Hospital any one Agent in the Team (your choice). That Agent is reduced to ZERO Health.
dialogue: "He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb. He's got a bomb..." - Mulder

title: Virtual Training
gameText: This card adds 2 points to an Agent's LRC or CRC skill (your choice) during the Combat.
dialogue:
Scully: "Where's Mulder?"
Langly: "Mulder's in level one."

title: Hand Bind
gameText: Play this card during a CLOSE RANGE COMBAT round on any Adversary with the Keyword PRIMORDIAL or that is capable of use MARTIAL ARTS cards. The Adversary is capable of binding an Agent (your choice) so that Agent does not deal damage in the rest of CRC rounds.
dialogue: "Go back to hell!" - Scully

title: Ammunition Reload
gameText: Play this card on any Agent during a LONG RANGE COMBAT round to double that Agent's LRC skill. This effect must be applied before any other modifier and only over the LRC listed on that Agent's card.
dialogue: "Protect me and mine with your quickening power." - Jared Chirp

title: Serpent Siege
gameText: Play on any PRIMORDIAL Adversary. One of that Adversary's opponents (your choice) is considered "paralyzed" for the next round of Combat. That Agent will deal no damage in the next round of Combat.
dialogue: "Help!" - Mulder

title: Backheld
gameText: Play this card on any combatant in a CLOSE RANGE COMBAT round to reduce the damage from any one source by two points. The combatant using this card does not deal damage in this CRC round.
dialogue: "Let him go, you hear me? Let him go!" - Reyes

title: Elusive Fugitive
gameText: Play on any PAWN or PRIMORDIAL Adversary to negate all damage allocated to that Adversary this round.
dialogue: "Hold the line, gentlemen! Look left! Look right! Hold the line!" - Agent Drummy

title: Smoke Grenade
gameText: Play this card on any combatant in a LONG RANGE COMBAT round to reduce the damage from any one source by two points.
dialogue: "Oh God, John, they're smoking us out. John, I need you here. I need you to focus here John." - Agent Reyes

title: Tossing Maneuver
gameText: Negates the effects of any one Equipment card that adds to CLOSE RANGE COMBAT Skill for the duration of this combat.
dialogue: "Knowle Rohrer? It can't be. I watched Knowle Rohrer die." - Doggett

title: Evasive Adversary
gameText: Play on any PRIMORDIAL Adversary to reduce damage from all opponent LONG RANGE COMBAT or CLOSE RANGE COMBAT sources by 1 this round.
dialogue: "We have an agent alone with a sicko who cutting out women's tongues, a guy known for his vanishing act." - Doggett

title: Agent Hedin
gameText: Place two tokens on Agent Hedion. Discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add any Keyword COMPUTER card to your hand. Show the card to your opponent and shuffle the deck.
bio: Agent Hedin assisted in the investigation by matching fingerprints found on the stairwell to Michael Kritschgau, an employee of the Pentagon's research division, leading to a pivotal breakthrough in identifying Scully's attacker.

title: Detective Pennock
gameText: Place a token on this card. Remove a token to look through your Bureau deck to draw any keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION card and add it to your hand. Shuffle your Bureau deck.
bio: Lloyd Pennock was part of the local police force in Wilmington, Delaware. He investigated a murder at Paradise Motel and encountered Marty Glenn, a blind woman, near the victim. Collaborating with Mulder and Scully, Pennock navigated the enigma, maintaining an open mind in uncovering Marty's mysterious Capabilities.

title: Assistant Director Brad Follmer
gameText: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token to add 1 to Follmer's BUREAUCRACY or OBSERVATION skill.
bio: Assistant Director Brad Follmer had a romantic history with Monica Reyes that he briefly brought up while trying to keep her away from the X-Files. Despite his political maneuvers and skepticism towards the X-Files, he aided Doggett in a crucial investigation. However, his involvement in organized crime tainted his reputation, leaving his future uncertain, possibly facing criminal charges.

title: SAC Fossa
gameText: Treat SAC Fossa as a RES 2 if she is in the Bureau. If Fossa is in the same Team as Agent Mosley Drummy and/or ASAC Dakota Whitney, she gains +1 to her COMPUTER and SCIENCES skills.
bio: Special Agent in Charge Fossa was a senior member of the FBI. She was part of an FBI team that consecutively searched for missing Agent Monica Bannan and then Cheryl Cunningham.

title: ASAC Dakota Whitney
gameText: ASAC Dakota Whitney's OBSERVATION and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills are increased by one if she and Agent Mosley Drummy are on the same Team.
bio: Dakota Whitney is an ASAC and a Special Agent in Charge at the FBI. While investigating the deaths of multiple abductees, she was instrumental in arranging the involvement of Agents Mulder and Scully.

title: Agent Mosley Drummy
gameText: Place a token on this card. Discard a token and look through your Bureau deck to draw any one Equipment card that increases CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill. Add it to your hand. Reshuffle your Bureau Deck.
bio: FBI Agent Mosley Drummy led investigations, aiding in high-profile cases alongside Mulder and Scully. Known for skepticism, pivotal role in arrests, and leadership during crises. Involved in capturing notorious criminals, including modern-day Frankenstein Doctor.

title: Agent Leyla Harrison
gameText: Place 1 [RP] on this card. This [RP] may be used to pay for any Keyword CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION or OCCULT INVESTIGATION cards. If you spend this [RP], you may replace it during the Briefing phase if Leyla Harrison is in the same Team as Agents Monica Reyes or John Doggett.
bio: Leyla Harrison was an agent assigned to the FBI. She transitioned from the accounting office to the X-Files unit. Leyla admirably pieced together Mulder and Scully's adventures, later assisting Reyes and Doggett in their investigations.

title: Agent Monica Reyes
gameText: If Agent Monica Reyes is in the Field, all Site cards with Keyword ALIEN INVESTIGATION or OCCULT INVESTIGATION may be played for 1 [RP] less.
bio: Assigned to the X-Files alongside Agent John Doggett, Monica Reyes was initially skeptical but later embraced belief in the paranormal. She's characterized by her intuition, open-mindedness, and spiritual inclinations. Reyes' dynamic nature adds depth to the investigative team, balancing skepticism with a willingness to explore unexplained phenomena.

title: Lizzy Gill
gameText: Lizzy Gill allows you to choose to add to the Conspiracy Pool instead of the Resource Pool during the Briefing Phase. Treat Lizzy Gill as RES 2 if she is in the same Team as Agent Scully. If so, Scully's HEALTH value is decreased by one.
bio: Lizzy Gill was introduced by Margaret Scully to assist during Scully's pregnancy. Later revealed as a scientist working for a faction interested in Scully's baby's genome. Despite suspicion, her actions imply Scully's baby is a natural miracle.

title: Agent John Doggett
gameText: Place one token on this card. Discard a token to negate one Bluff. Additionally, if Agent Doggett is on the same Team as Agent Scully, change her Keyword SKEPTIC to BELIEVER.
bio: John Doggett is a no-nonsense Agent who frequently applies his down to earth sensibilities. A former a marine and NYPD detective, Doggett joined The X-Files, partnering with Dana Scully and later Monica Reyes, investigating unsolved cases with mysterious or supernatural elements. His son Luke Doggett was abducted and murdered.

title: Agent Jeffrey Spender
gameText: Place one token on this card. Discard a token and look through your Bureau deck to draw any on Keyword MOTIVE or RESULT Site card. Add that card to your hand. Reshuffle your Bureau deck.
bio: Jeffrey Frank Spender is the son of the Cigarette Smoking Man and Cassandra Spender, as well as the paternal half-brother of Agent Fox Mulder. He worked as a Special Agent in the FBI, assigned to the X-Files unit, partnered with Agent Diana Fowley.

title: Conrad Lozano
gameText: Treat Agent Conrad Lozano as RES 1 if the Team he belongs makes an ALIEN INVESTIGATION 5+ skill during the Briefing phase.
bio: Lozano is of Mexican descent but is American by nationality. He works at the INS Service Processing Center in Fresno, CA. Despite his skepticism, Lozano agrees to help Agent Mulder locate Eladio Buente, indicating his willingness to assist in the investigation despite his doubts about the supernatural elements involved.

title: Agent Flagler
gameText: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token during your Briefing phase as Active player to be able to purchase one additional card from your Bureau deck after the first purchase of cards. You must still pay for each card drawn this way.
bio: Agent Flagler is a meticulous investigator that analyzes evidence and handwriting samples for the FBI. Flagler's attention to detail contributed to unraveling a mysterious kidnapping case, collaborating with Mulder and Scully.

title: Agent Chesty Short
gameText: Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token during your Briefing phase as Directed player to be able to purchase one additional card from your Bureau deck after the first purchase of cards. You must still pay for each card drawn this way.
bio: Agent Chesty Short is a bureaucratic figure that criticizes Mulder and Scully's investigations' expense and efficacy. He doubts their belief in aliens and symbolizes the bureaucratic skepticism that often opposes Mulder and Scully's pursuit of the paranormal.

title: Michael Lee Kritschgau
gameText: Place one token on Kritschgau. Discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add a keyword BUREAUCRACY Witness card to your hand. Show it to your opponent and shuffle the deck. Additionally, if he is on the same Team as Agent Mulder, change Mulder's Keyword BELIEVER to SKEPTIC.
bio: Michael Kritschgau was an employee of the Department of Defense. He stole a core sample from an FBI lab and later revealed Mulder that UFO conspiracy was a cover-up for military experiments.

title: Detective John Kresge
gameText: If Detective Kresge is in the same Team as Agent Scully, they both gain a +1 to their cumulative OBSERVATION and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills, and a -1 to their SUBTERFUGE and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: Detective John Kresge was a seasoned San Diego police officer that assisted Agent Dana Scully in investigating Mrs. Roberta Sim's apparent suicide. He updated her on Marshall Sim's confession regarding the murder case. This interaction showcases Kresge's role as a reliable ally to Scully.

title: SAC Darius Michaud
gameText: Any time during the Game you can sacrifice SAC Darius Michaud. Remove the card from the Game. If so, you may ask any one Characteristic question regarding one opponent's X-File.
bio: Special Agent in Charge Darius Michaud played a significant role in the investigation of the mysterious bombing of a Federal Building in Dallas, Texas. He sacrificed himself in the building while searching for the bomb, demonstrating his dedication to duty and the safety of others.

title: Deputy Alvin Kersh
gameText: Treat Dep. Director Alvin Kersh as a RES 3 if he is in the Bureau Section of the table. Kersh also allows you to choose to add to the Conspiracy Pool instead of the Resource Pool during the Briefing Phase.
bio: Alvin Kersh obstructed Mulder and Scully's paranormal investigations, assigning them mundane tasks, later Overseeing their work. Kersh, a former U.S. Air Force pilot, brought military discipline to his role. His skepticism towards the X-Files drove bureaucratic actions, often impeding the Agents their pursuit of the Truth.

title: Agent Peyton Ritter
gameText: Agent Peyton Ritter's BUREAUCRACY skill is increased by one if he and Deputy Alvin Kersh are on the same Team. If Agent Peyton Ritter is in the same Team as Agent Dana Scully, she loses one HEALTH.
bio: Agent Peyton Ritter accompanied Scully to investigate Alfred Fellig, a crime scene photographer suspected of staging deaths. Ritter exhibited a single-minded focus on building a case against Fellig, disregarding Scully's cautious approach and revealing a dependency on the directives of his superior, Alvin Kersh.

title: Agent Diana Fowley
gameText: Agent Fowley allows you to choose to add to the Conspiracy Pool instead of the Resource Pool during the Briefing Phase. If Agent Fowley is in the same Team as Agent Dana Scully, both gain a -1 to their cumulative CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: As an FBI Special Agent, Diana Fowley investigated Gibson Praise with Agent Spender before joining Mulder's search for an Alien Hybrid. Despite her involvement, her motivations remained mysterious, leading to speculation about her ties to the Syndicate and her role with Mulder.

title: Detective Norman
gameText: Detective Norman's LONG RANGE COMBAT skill is doubled against any EVOLUTIONARY adversary played on any Team he belongs. Additionally, if Detective Norman is in any Team including Fox Mulder, add 1 to Norman's CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skill.
bio: Norman was a detective with the Newark County Police Department who was Mulder's contact in New Jersey on what Mulder initially thought was a routine homicide investigation.

title: Agent Thomas
gameText: Place a [RP] token on this card. This may be used to pay for for any CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION or BEHAVIORAL cards. If you use this [RP], replace it during your briefing phase.
bio: Agent Thomas helped FBI agents Mulder and Scully to find traces that lead them to Lucas Henry, by showing Liz Hawley, a series of Polaroid photographs of a possible suspect.

title: Detective Barron
gameText: Place two tokens on Detective Barron. Discard a token to play a Bluff card from your hand at half its cost. Additionally, Barron's BEHAVIORAL and CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION skills are increased by one if he and Agent Kelly Ryan are in the same Team.
bio: Barron was a detective with the Richmond, Virginia police and the superior of Kelly Ryan. He was an extremely short-tempered man who viewed the involvement of the FBI as an intrusion onto his turf.

title: Agent Ambrose Chapel
gameText: Place two tokens on Ambrose Chapel. Discard one token during any skill check to add 1 to Ambrose Chapel's ALIEN INVESTIGATION or SUBTERFUGE skill. If Ambrose Chapel's Team is attacked by the Alien Bounty Hunter, Chapel may not participate in the Combat, but he may still contribute to the Site skill check.
bio: Ambrose Chapel is an Agent that works for the Central Intelligence Agency (C.I.A.). He was impersonated by the Alien Bounty Hunter.

title: Detective Kelly Ryan
gameText: Place one token on Detective Kelly Ryan. Discard a token to look through your Bureau deck any time during the game to draw any one Bluff card. Show the Bluff to your opponent and shuffle the deck.
bio: Kelly Ryan became a detective with the Richmond Police Department in Virginia after being tutored as a student of Dana Scully. She asked for assistance from Scully and Mulder when investigating a bizarre series of murders and while searching for Dr. Chester Ray Banton.

title: Agent Craig Willmore
gameText: If Agent Craig Willmore is in the same Team as Agent Pendrell, Willmore gains a +1 to his COMPUTER and SCIENCES skills, and a -1 to his ALIEN INVESTIGATION skill.
bio: Craig Willmore is a Special Agent for the FBI field office in Seattle, Washington. On April 2, 1996, he was assigned to investigate the disappearance of Agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully.

title: Computer Forensic Holly
gameText: Place one token on this card. Remove one token to add a +1 modifier to any COMPUTER or EVIDENCE COLLECTION skill check made by the Team including Polly.
bio: Holly, a government worker for the FBI, worked in the Computer Records Office. Influenced by "Pusher" Robert Patrick Modell, she leaked confidential records. She also worked in the FBI Communications Center, investigating repeated calls to Skinner's floor, while remaining friends with Agent Dana Scully.

title: Detective Waltos
gameText: Place one token on Detective Waltos. Discard one token to search through your Bureau deck and add an Equipment card of cost not higher than 2 [RP]. Add it to your hand, reshuffle your Bureau deck. If the card drawn is the "Lie Detector" you may attach it to Waltos immediately for zero cost.
bio: Detective Waltos was in charge of the investigation into the murder of Carina Sayles, of which Assistant Director Walter Skinner was accused. Skinner, a suspect in the murder case, was uncooperative, refusing to take a lie-detector test.

title: Marita Covarrubias
gameText: If Marita Covarrubias is in the same Team as Agent Alex Krycek, they both gain +1 to their cumulative ALIEN INVESTIGATION and SCIENCES skills, and -1 to their CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION and EVIDENCE COLLECTION skills.
bio: Assistant to one of the Special Representatives of the of the UN Secretary General, Marita Covarrubias is a mysterious character with little know background who provided top secret information to Agent Fox Mulder, whilst working with The Cigarette-Smoking Man.

title: Janke Dacyshyn
gameText: The LONG RANGE COMBAT round is skipped. Dacyshyn engages one opposing Agent (your choice) in Combat. If Dacyshyn reduces  the Agent to zero HEALTH, place this card on top of the Agent along with 3 tokens. Remove one token during each Briefing phase. When no tokens are on the Agent, move the Agent to the Hospital including the damage tokens. This card is considered an ABDUCTION card.
dialogue: "I'm transporting vital organ." - Janke Dacyshyn

title: Blinding Predator
gameText: The LONG RANGE COMBAT round is skipped. Target Agent in the Team attacked by the Blinding Predator receives a poisonous attack and is considered "blinded" for the first CLOSE RANGE COMBAT round. That Agent will deal no damage during that round of combat.
dialogue: "Whatever happened to Sacks, I think it's happening to me. I'm completely blind now." - Leyla Harrison

title: The Bat Thing
gameText: The LONG RANGE COMBAT round is skipped. This card may be played in its normal way or on any Team that includes at least one Agent with the keyword SKEPTIC, ignoring Activator requirements.The Human Bat may use SUBTERFUGE Combat cards.
dialogue: "Today, he might have been fine but this thing hunts like a bat. It only attacks at night." - Ernie Stefaniuk

title: Schlugg's Cult
gameText: Attach this card to any Agent in a Team. Place five tokens on this card (three if the Team has any Agent with MEDICAL skill). The Agent must remain in the Field and cannot contribute to any Skill check until all tokens have been removed. Remove one token during each Active player's Debriefing Phase. Discard this card when the last token is removed. The Agent remains in the Field. Schlugg's Cult does not initiate Combat.
dialogue: "No! Ahhh!!! You son of a bitch!" - Scully

title: Ronnie Strickland
gameText: Only Agents with the Keyword BELIEVER may cause damage to Ronnie Strickland. If at any time during the Combat the Team attacked by Ronnie Strickland contains no Agents with the Keyword BELIEVER,the Combat ends immediately.
dialogue: "Oh, man! What'd you have to go and do that for? You are in big trouble." - Ronnie Strickland

title: Animated Snakes
gameText: Play this card for 2 [CP] less if played on a Site card with the Keyword OCCULT INVESTIGATION.
dialogue: Scully: "..Maybe it's symbolic. I mean, serpents and religion have gone hand in hand. They've represented the temptation of Eve -- Original Sin. They've been feared and hated throughout history as they've been thought to embody Satan -- to serve Evil itself".

title: Lasioderma Serricorne Outbreak
gameText: This card does not initiate Combat. Place target Agent under this card. The Agent may not contribute to any skill check this turn nor generate RES while under this card. At the beginning of your opponent's next Healing phase, remove this card from the game and send the Agent to the Hospital with two damage tokens.
dialogue: Scully: "...it could be some form of contagious agent, like an insect-borne bacterium..."

title: Whanshang Dole
gameText: Wanshang Dhole deals damage to its opponents first during each CRC round. If the HEALTH value of any opponent reaches zero after applying  modifiers or healing cards,that combatant is sent to the Hospital and cannot deliver any damage back that round.
dialogue: "Hey, Buck. What's wrong, Buck?" - Dr James Riley

title: Faceless Alien Rebel
gameText: At the start of each Combat round you may play one Combat card from your Discard Pile (at normal cost). Remove from the game each Combat card played this way. Subtract one from all damage sources applied to this Adversary during the LRC round.
dialogue: "Plans that would have worked had not a rebel alien race come to destroy them." - The Cigarette Smoking Man
createdBy: Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel, Greg Fremaux

title: Maitreya's Virtual Menace
gameText: Maitreya may use MARTIAL ARTS Combat cards. The damage dealt by her on any Agent can be considered "virtual": the Agents' controller may remove 1 point of damage (1 token) from any Agent damaged by Maitreya for each 2 [RP]'s spent on that Agent. This action may prevent those Agents to be sent to the Hospital.
dialogue: Scully: "She's input herself into the game. We have to download her."

title: Aquatic Nightmare
dialogue: Scully: "I don't think these wounds are bites or stings. There's something in here, Mulder, right under the skin."

title: Kill Switch
gameText: This card does not initiate Combat. The Kill Switch creates a distorted reality on the Team of Agents and deals a total of 5 points of damage that may be split among all opponents (Directed Player's choice). Subtract the COMPUTER skill of each chosen Agent from the damage delivered by the Kill Switch to that Agent.
dialogue: "What's that smell? Oh, jeez!" - Mulder

title: Alien Spider Host
gameText: Attach the Alien Spider to an Agent in a Team of two or more Agents. That Agent becomes aggressive and attacks their own Team sequentially, one by one (your choice). Then the infected Agent moves on to the next Agent, until all Agents are defeated or until he is sent to the Hospital. Discard this card afterwards.
dialogue: "I'm dead, too, inside, because of this thing they put in me. For what? To turn me into some kind of killing machine, or just to see what would happen?" - Edward Skur

title: Karin's Dark Sorcery
gameText: The LONG RANGE COMBAT round is skipped. For each Agent that Karin's Dark Sorcery sends to the Hospital you may remove up to 4 [RP] from your opponent's Resource Pool.
dialogue: Mulder: "Make him stop, Karin!  Tell him what you should have told him twenty years  ago. You're not going to take it anymore."

title: Mothman's Lair
gameText: The Mothman is negated if the Team it attacks makes a successful SUBTERFUGE +4 skill check. The LRC round is skipped. For the first round of CRC, the chosen Agent is the only one who may participate in the Combat. The Mothman may use SUBTERFUGE cards.
dialogue: Mulder: "Witnesses described them as primitive looking men with red piercing eyes. Became known as the "moth men." I've got an X-File dating back to 1952 on it."

title: Demonic Puppet
gameText: The Demonic Puppet initiates Combat but does not assign nor receive any damage. Instead, the selected Agent in a Team inflicts a wound upon himself or herself equal to the sum of their LRC & CRC values, applied only once. Healing cards may be used to prevent damage, including any Combat cards that do not modify LRC and/or CRC.
dialogue: Scully: "Give me the doll, Polly."

title: Wetwired
gameText: Play on an Agent in a Team of 2 or more Agents. That Agent initiates Combat against another Agent in the Team (your choice). Follow usual Combat rules until any of the Agents' HEALTH is reduced to zero. The Combat ends and that Agent (or both) must go to the Hospital. The remaining Team may still contribute to the Site skill check as usual.
dialogue: Langly: "This device is stimulating electrical activity in the brain."

title: Cult Carnage
gameText: Play this card on a Team in the Field that plays a Witness during the Investigation phase. The Witness card is discarded. Instead, that Witness joins the Temple of the Seven Stars and will attack one of the Agents in that Team only during an LRC round.
dialogue: "I knew you were coming. I've known for nine centuries. It was written in the Revelation of Jesus Christ...." - Vernon Ephesian

title: The Twins Poisonous Attack
gameText: This card does not initiate combat. The Team must make an OBSERVATION 5+ skill check. If unsuccessful, choose one Agent in the Team. That Agent receives 4 points of damage but can still contribute with his skills if HEALTH rating has not been reduced to 0. Healing cards can be played to avoid the damage.
dialogue: "We didn't drink enough to make us sick." - Scully

title: Fetishist Prey Women Hunter
gameText: This card can only be played on a female Agent in a Team investigating a Site.
dialogue: "Some people collect salt and pepper shakers. The fetishist collects dead things. Hair, fingernails... no one quite knows why, though I've never quite understood salt and pepper shakers myself." - Mulder

title: Subliminal Assault
gameText: Play this card on a Team of two or more Agents. Choose an Agent at random and attach this card to that Agent. The Agent engages in Combat against the rest of Agents  on the Team. You control the Agent as an Adversary until the Combat ends. Discard this card afterwards.
dialogue: "Mulder: Are you familiar with subliminal messages?"

title: The Walk (alternate)
gameText: Subtract one from all damage sources applied to this Adversary.
dialogue: "I know a lot of crips have the same dream. The Walk. In my dream, I rise up, out of my chair, and I can stand. I look down  the hallway, I'm not in the ward anymore, I'm home. With my baby girl." - Amputee

title: Visions of a Shaman
gameText: Pick the top three cards of your Bureau deck. Use the cost of the first one for the Shaman's LRC skill, the cost of the second as CRC, and the last one as HEALTH value (draw additional cards if needed if the cost of any of those cards is not a specific number). Shuffle your Bureau afterwards (including the drawn cards).
dialogue: "...there are powers that should not be disturbed... That some things are better left buried." - Mulder

title: Chung's Cosmic Goliath
gameText: This card does not initiate Combat. Pick one Agent from an investigating Team. That Agent remains "confused" until end of turn and cannot contribute his or her skills to any Site skill check.
dialogue: "Jack... what is that thing?" - Alien

title: The Gray Haired Man
gameText: Reduce each Agent's LRC to 1. If target Team has more than one Agent, Your opponent may select one of those Agents not to participate in the Combat. If no Agent is chosen, then an additional LRC round will be played until your opponent selects an Agent to skip the Combat.
dialogue: "I've suffered some very personal... losses recently, and... I was... I was hoping…" - Mulder
createdBy: Greg Fremaux, Alfredo Sánchez, Robert Czepiel

title: George and Sherman Peacock's attack
gameText: If any Agent on target Team has an Equipment card attached that increases LRC skill you can attach that card to Peacock's brothers instead (only during the LONG RANGE COMBAT round and only one Equipment card, your choice).
dialogue: "Where's the other brother... Edmund? " - Mulder

title: Vassily Peskow
gameText: The chosen Agent is the only one who may participate in the Combat. This card cannot be played over Agent Alex Krycek. Vassily Peskow can use SUBTERFUGE cards.
dialogue: "I am only here, Comrade, to congratulate you on a fine job." - Krycek

title: Knowle Rohrer
gameText: Knowle Rohrer regenerates (heals) one point of HEALTH at the beginning of each combat round as long as his HEALTH is not at zero.
dialogue: "Shoot me, Agent Doggett, if you think it'll make a difference this time." - Knowle Rohrer

title: The Siddhi Mystic's Curse
gameText: Draw a number of cards from your Bureau deck equal to the number of Agents on target team. Use the cost value of each drawn card to assign damage to any Agent in that team (your choice) as separated LRC attacks. Draw enough cards until you have numerical values to assign the damage. Shuffle the deck (including the drawn cards.
dialogue: "The Siddhi are a very mysterious and particularly powerful order of Fakirs." - C. Burks

title: Erwin Lukesh
gameText: Play this card on a team of Agents. The Agents in that team cannot deliver any damage to Erwin Lukesh during the LONG RANGE COMBAT round unless they have OBSERVATION or SUBTERFUGE skills. Erwin Lukesh may use SUBTERFUGE cards.
dialogue: "God, I enjoyed it.  You bled just like a pig" - Erwin Lukesh

title: Van Allen's Revenge
gameText: Once the Combat had ended, you can pay 2 [CP] to return Van Allen's Revenge to your hand. Your opponent may pay 3 [RP] to interrupt this effect.
dialogue: "Don't feel sorry. You going to hell just like I am, brother." - Ed Kelso

title: Rob Roberts, the voracious predator
gameText: At the beginning of each Combat round you may choose one Agent and reduce that Agent's HEALTH by 2. If the Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0 by the end of that round, Rob Roberts also heals 2 points of HEALTH during that round.
dialogue: "What look like tool marks to you look to me like something more organic. Like it was made by a... a tongue or a proboscis." - Scully

title: Lord of the Flies
gameText: At the beginning of each combat round, you may choose one Agent. That Agent is webbed and cannot attack or use abilities that round. If that Agent's HEALTH is reduced to 0 by the end of the Combat, you may draw one extra card at the start of your next Briefing phase.
dialogue: "Your mouth, your tongue... there's something wrong with you." - Natalie Gordon

title: Jinn's Twisted Wish
gameText: This card does not initiate combat. Put this card face up in your opponent's Bureau deck and reshuffle the deck. When this card reaches the top of the deck, your opponent's turn as Active player ends immediately. This card has no effect if it reaches the top of the deck during your opponent's turn as Directed player.
dialogue: "I wish for peace on earth." - Mulder

title: Sect Leader Anthony Tipet
gameText: You may play this card in its normal way, or use it to immediately end combat and control one Agent (your choice). Move the Agent to any section of the table. The Agent must remain in that section. Attach this card to the chosen Agent as a reminder. Discard this card during your opponent's next Investigation phase.
dialogue: "If we have the courage to see into darkness we see into God... free of the clay which confines us." - Anthony Tipet

title: Caballero, Memory Vampire
gameText: This card does not initiate combat. Play this card in your Field section. Place two tokens on this card. Discard a token anytime to look at the top three cards of your opponent's Bureau deck or to avoid an Agent to heal damage tokens during the Healing phase. When no tokens remain, move this card to the discard pile.
dialogue: "¿Dónde está el americano ahorita?" - Caballero
